kpa.model

Class KGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • kpa.model.AbstractGroup
      • kpa.model.KGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<KCell>

    public class KGrid
extends AbstractGroup
implements java.lang.Iterable<KCell>
    A rectangular grid of cells for a Kakuro puzzle, with the list of hints. A hint consists of a number that is the desired sum of the numbers appearing in a group of horizontally or vertically adjacent cells. Such a group is called an entry.

        public KGrid(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Constructs a grid from a given scanner.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the given scanner
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if scanner == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if scanner does not yield a valid Kakuro puzzle
        Precondition:
        scanner != null and it delivers a valid puzzle grid

      • getCell

        public KCell getCell(int rowIndex,
                     int columnIndex)
        Gets the cell at given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the row coordinate to get from
        columnIndex - the column coordinate to get from
        Returns:
        cell at rowIndex, columnIndex
        Precondition:
        0 <= rowIndex < getRows() && 0 <= columnIndex < getColumns()
        Postcondition:
        \result = cells[rowIndex, columnIndex]

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        cell at rowIndex, columnIndex
        Precondition:
        location appears in grid
        Postcondition:
        \result == cell at location

      • associate

        public static void associate(KCell cell,
                             AbstractGroup group)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Puts a cell in a group.
        Parameters:
        cell - the cell to put
        group - the group to put into
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if precondition violated
        Precondition:
        cell != null && group != null && ! cell.isElementOf(group) && ! group.contains(cell)
        Postcondition:
        group.contains(cell)
